name: Central American Music
description: Music from the Central American region (including Belize, Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Panama).

children.name: Brukdown
children.description: Belizean Creole genre typified by the use of accordion, banjo, and a distinctive percussion section.

children.name: Cumbia salvadoreña
children.description: Takes influence from local Salvadoran music and traditionally features a distinctive ensemble.

children.name: Garifuna Music
children.description: Music of the Garifuna, an Afro-Indigenous people from Central America and Saint Vincent and the Grenadines.

children.name: Palo de mayo
children.description: Upbeat music accompanying maypole dancing from the Caribbean coast of Central America.

children.name: Purísima
children.description: Nicaraguan Hymns to the Immaculate Conception of Mary, sung during holiday celebrations and in liturgical or parochial services.

children.name: Son de pascua
children.description: Lively instrumental Christmas songs from Central America composed in 6/8 or triple meter.

children.name: Son nica
children.description: Nicaraguan popular rhythm in distinctive guitar strums, with lyrics relating to the countryside and peasant life.

children.name: Tamborera
children.description: Panamanian popular genre which mixes local Tamborito with Cuban Music rhythms featuring the tambora as the main percussion instrument.

children.name: Tamborito
children.description: Folk music and dance from Panama dating back to the 17th century.

children.name: Xuc
children.description: Danceable style from El Salvador developed in the 1940s.
